explanation: The bug is that S = input().split() makes S a list of tokens, so S.count('T') and S.count('A') (and S[-1] being the last character) don't work as intended for a single string of characters. Replacing .split() with .strip() makes S a string so count and indexing operate on characters.
fixed_code:
N = int(input())
S = input().strip()

T_W = S.count('T')
A_W = S.count('A')
print("T" if T_W > A_W or T_W == A_W and S[-1] == "A" else "A")
